articles.title: Nvidia is hit by another ‘crypto hangover,’ and that isn’t the only problem
articles.summary: Nvidia is facing a "crypto hangover" and other issues as the pandemic-era booms in PC sales, videogames, and cryptocurrency decline. The company warned of a $1.4 billion revenue shortfall due to weak gaming equipment sales and excess inventory. Nvidia's stock fell 6.3% on the news, reflecting broader concerns about multiple challenges impacting its core business.

articles.title: Nvidia warns of lower second-quarter revenue on gaming weakness
articles.summary: Nvidia Corp warned of a 19% drop in second-quarter revenue from the prior quarter due to weakness in its gaming business, sending its shares down by about 8%. This follows similar warnings from other chipmakers and is attributed to consumers weighing purchases of discretionary items amidst economic concerns, as well as continued supply chain issues. The company expects to report overall Q2 revenue of approximately $6.70 billion, significantly below analyst estimates.

articles.title: Chipmakers tumble on fears of worst downturn in 10 years
articles.summary: Semiconductor stocks experienced a significant downturn following Micron Technology Inc.'s warning of slowing demand, raising concerns about the industry heading into a prolonged slump. Analysts believe the sector is entering its worst downturn in a decade, affecting every company and end market. Despite recent shortages and investments, the rapid evaporation of demand has taken experts by surprise, with some companies like Micron already cutting future spending.

articles.title: Thematic Times: Semiconductors Power Thematic Indexes
articles.summary: The article discusses how semiconductor stocks are crucial to many thematic indexes, particularly after the CHIPS and Science Act. It highlights direct and indirect exposure of various thematic indexes to semiconductors and the long-term benefits of the CHIPS Act for the industry and end users. The growth of the semiconductor market is primarily driven by the automotive sector, data storage, and wireless communications.

articles.title: Cathie Wood sells Block shares to double down on Nvidia
articles.summary: Ark Invest, led by Cathie Wood, sold over $20 million worth of Block (SQ) shares and simultaneously purchased over $65 million worth of Nvidia (NVDA) shares across three of its funds. This move follows Ark's previous decision to exit PayPal (PYPL) to bet on Block, and comes amidst macroeconomic turbulence causing significant losses in various asset classes, including Block and Bitcoin. Ark also recently sold Coinbase (COIN) shares due to regulatory uncertainty.

articles.title: Arista acquires Pluribus Networks for cloud fabric product
articles.summary: Arista Networks has acquired Pluribus Networks to enhance its Unified Cloud Fabric product and gain entry into the telco market. The acquisition will integrate Pluribus's technology to create a software-defined network across various hardware components, targeting 4G/5G telco operators and leveraging relationships with partners like Ericsson and Nvidia. This move follows Arista's strategy of acquiring SDN vendors to bolster its networking capabilities.

articles.title: Arista Buys Pluribus Networks To Grow Cloud Networking Offering
articles.summary: Arista Networks has acquired Pluribus Networks to enhance its Converged Cloud Fabric offering and strengthen its partnership with Ericsson. This is Arista's second acquisition in the quarter, following Untangle, as it focuses on acquiring technology and talent that align with its culture to expand its cloud networking solutions and address lower-end security and edge threat management markets. The acquisition was disclosed as Arista reported surpassing $1 billion in quarterly revenue for the first time, despite ongoing global supply chain challenges.

articles.title: Wall Street closes little changed on Fed policy fears
articles.summary: Wall Street closed mostly flat due to concerns over the Federal Reserve's aggressive stance on inflation following strong jobs data, compounded by a revenue warning from chipmaker Nvidia. Investors are now awaiting consumer price data to assess the Fed's future monetary policy. Despite a recent market rebound, analysts suggest the market might be subject to further pullbacks.
